update.description:
Add API for setting shadow texture size. Larger shadow texture size generally produces higher quality shadows.

Not part of this PR is a `ShadowPlugin` in `shadow_texture_plugin_7` branch that I created to demonstrate the functionality. If you're interested in trying it out, you can switch to that branch and run:

~~~
gazebo worlds/box_shadow_plugin.world
~~~

Bring up the camera sensor image in Topic Viewer and see that the shadows have reduced in quality (size changed from 1024 to 256).

jenkins:

[xenial-nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/64/) - should be ok. The test failures look unrelated
update.title: Support setting shadow texture size

content.html: 61b0ba1

content.raw: actually that applies to `EXPECT_EQ`, in this case it's GT so I think the order is correct.  I tried `EXPECT_GT(0u, scene->ShadowTextureSize())` and it failed
content.html: actually that applies to EXPECT_EQ, in this case it's GT so I think the order is correct. I tried EXPECT_GT(0u, scene->ShadowTextureSize()) and it failed

content.raw: ya makes sense, we've been doing it wrong everywhere. I'll update the ones in this test
content.html: ya makes sense, we've been doing it wrong everywhere. I'll update the ones in this test

content.raw: ya I was planning on doing that but realized that users could also do `RTShaderSystem::Instance()->SetShadowTextureSize(x)`, which would cause the value to be different from scene. Ideally users should just use the Scene API but we currently can't stop them from accessing RTShaderSystem directly.
content.html: ya I was planning on doing that but realized that users could also do RTShaderSystem::Instance()->SetShadowTextureSize(x), which would cause the value to be different from scene. Ideally users should just use the Scene API but we currently can't stop them from accessing RTShaderSystem directly.

content.raw:
Picture for the curious

![pss_texture_size.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4044462950-pss_texture_size.png)
content.html: Picture for the curious

content.raw:
The language gtest uses when printing failures expects the golden value to come first, and the statement being tested second.
`EXPECT_GT(0u, scene->ShadowTextureSize())`

It doesn't change the behavior of the test, but it makes failures easier to read.
content.html:
The language gtest uses when printing failures expects the golden value to come first, and the statement being tested second. EXPECT_GT(0u, scene->ShadowTextureSize())

It doesn't change the behavior of the test, but it makes failures easier to read.

content.raw: since shadowTextureSize is set on [3205](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2644/support-setting-shadow-texture-size/diff#Lgazebo/rendering/Scene.ccT3205), could the "else" case handle both cases?
content.html: since shadowTextureSize is set on 3205, could the "else" case handle both cases?
